title.narrative: Accelerating Agriculture and Agribusiness in South Sudan for Enhanced Economic Development (A3 SEED)

description.narrative: A3 SEED project is a five year (2021 to 2025) project funded by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands (EKN) in Juba. A3 SEED aims to provide market-oriented interventions to move from humanitarian support to a commercial, sustainable, and adaptive agriculture sector. A3 SEED seeks to reach more than 100,000 farming households that will see a doubling of income from marketable surpluses of targeted commodities, thereby improving livelihoods.In order to expand on EKN’s seed sector and agribusiness interventions in South Sudan, A3-SEED aims to move the seed sector from humanitarian support to a commercial, sustainable, and adaptive agriculture sector. A3-SEED ensures the availability of improved seed down to the last mile through agri-entrepreneurship and support of existing private-sector seed companies. The project improves seed and input marketing, distribution, and production practices. Additionally, A3-SEED supports the emergence of individual commercial seed producers that produce for the local market and/or are out growers for a seed company.

A3-SEED targets semi-commercial and commercial farmers, as well as pre-commercial farmers who are at the cusp of engaging more intensively with markets, i.e., through the push- pull design of A3-SEED interventions, who could purchase inputs and those who already are selling or who have the potential to sell surplus to the market. A3-SEED does not target subsistence farmers directly but will build synergies with humanitarian programs in target areas to potentially work with “graduates” who are ready to make the transition to pre-commercial farming. Priority will be given to farmers who have returned after fleeing the community or the country due to insecurity.

Expected Outcomes More than 100,000 farming households will see a doubling of income from marketable surpluses of targeted commodities, improving their livelihoods. Over 50,000 directly and 50,000 indirectly trained farmers will realize 50% and 20% yield increases, respectively, of targeted commodities. Development of 100 agro-dealers, 200 new businesses owned or managed by women, and 200 businesses owned or managed by youth will be facilitated. Over 42,000 hectares of farmland under agroecological production and improved farming practices will become more resilient to shocks. 50% of relief seed will be procured locally, coordinated through the Seed Trade Association of South Sudan (STASS).

title.narrative: Annual report 2021
Number of people with improved food intake

This indicator requires finding out household food consumption groups and these includes: starches, pulses, vegetables, fruit, meat, dairy, fats, sugar. There are standard weights for each of the food groups that comprise the food consumption score. The unit of measurement is Weighted sum of frequency of household consumption, a continuous variable with a possible range of 0 to 112. The module gathers food consumption data based on a 7 day recall. (‘how many days in the last 7 days did your household eat xx?’). These data are grouped into food consumption groups (maximum value of 7) and then, using standardized weights, combined into a composite score (the Food Consumption Score).
1.6 Number of hectares of farmland under >2 conservation practices:

The indicator is looking for hectares of land ha is under more than two conservation practices which includes Conservation Cover, Conservation Crop Rotation, Residue and Tillage Management, No-Till, High Tunnel System, Amending Soil Properties with Gypsum, Controlled Traffic Farming, Cover Crop, Residue & Tillage Management, Reduced-Till, Mulching, Irrigation Water Management, Forage and Biomass Planting, Prescribed Grazing, Range Planting, Nutrient Management, Pest Management Conservation System, Salinity & Sodic Soil Management, Soil Carbon Amendment.water limitation, such as irrigated or wet region) or Water-limited potential yield (for the rainfed region) and Farm yield (FY). It is the final result of multiple factors, such as environmental factors, management practices, pests, and diseases.
Number of existing seed companies with tripled seed derived turn-over

The indicator is looking at existing seed companies that have tripled their seed derived turn-over. In other words, this is the amount that new existing seed companies invoice to their customers for the sale of seeds or delivery of seed related services.
RA3 Number of agro-input suppliers (min 50% youth, 50% women) engaged in inclusive agribusiness.
Number of agro-input suppliers (min 50% youth, 50% women) engaged in inclusive agribusiness.
RA1 % of relief seed procured nationally, coordinated through STASS

Relief seed in the context of south sudan refers to seeds that are distributed for free to the vulnerable households across the country, this is mainly conducted by the humanitarian Agencies Operating in the country. This indicator looks at the seeds that are procured by Humanitarian Agencies and Coordinated By STASS, meaning STASS will directly Lobby for the local sourcing of the seeds the humanitarian agencies distribute as relief seeds in the county.
RA1 Number of community-based seed producers groups reaching an annual seed related turnover of more than 10,000 USD

The indicator is looking at community-based seed companies that have their seed derived turnover of at least 10,000 USD. In other words, this is the amount that community-based seed companies invoice to their customers for the sale of seeds or delivery of seed related services.
RA3 Number of farmers introduced to women economic empowerment module

This indicator is looking at number of farmers that are trained on women economic empowerment module to better understand the contribution of women in economic development. Women Economic empowerment is the capacity of women to participate in, contribute to and benefit from growth processes in ways that recognise the value of their contributions, respect their dignity and make it possible to negotiate a fairer distribution of the benefits of growth.
RA3 Number of new jobs created by agro-dealers
This indicator is looking new jobs created (paid position of regular employment ) as a result of establishment of Agro dealer shops.
RA2 Number of farmers trained directly on quality seed use and associated good agricultural practices

This indicator looks at farmers trained directly on use of quality seeds and good Agricultural which includes Conservation Cover, Conservation Crop Rotation, Residue and Tillage Management, No-Till, High Tunnel System, Amending Soil Properties with Gypsum, Controlled Traffic Farming, Cover Crop, Residue & Tillage Management, Reduced-Till, Mulching, Irrigation Water Management, Forage and Biomass Planting, Prescribed Grazing, Range Planting, Nutrient Management, Pest Management Conservation System, Salinity & Sodic Soil Management, Soil Carbon Amendment.
RA3 Number of agricultural actors benefitting from ABC establishment.
This indicator looks at number of agricultural actors that refers to agents that are responsible in agricultural Value chain such as the farmer groups, NGO, Input supplier, MAF, traders
RA1 % of STASS costs covered through direct member contributions

STASS means Seed Trade Association of South Sudan. The indicator refers to the rate of STASS costs that have been covered through direct contribution of the members through resource and financial aid among others aimed and complementing the achievements of the STASS activities.
RA1. Number of seed companies engaging in EGS production

Early generation seeds also know as foundation seeds or basic seed, is the descendent of breeder seed and is produced under conditions that ensure maintaining genetic purity and identity.This indicator is only looking at seed companies that deal in the production of early generation seeds in the project implementation site.
Increase of yields of targeted crops by beneficiaries

This indicator looks at yield increase that refers to doubling of the productivity of the farm crops by the farmer beneficiaries. As crop yields increase and production technology improves. This can be realizes when beneficiaries adopt good farming practices for the project targeted crops.
Increased volume of EGS produced

Increased volume refers to additional quantities of Early generation seeds also know as foundation seeds or basic seed produced. This indicator refers to the increase in the quantity of the early generation seeds that should be four times that original quantity which will be determined by the baseline assessment that will be conducted.
1.3Number of small scale producers that progressively decrease the yield gap

Yield gap (Yg) is the difference between Potential Yields (for the region without water limitation, such as irrigated or wet region) or Water-limited potential yield (for the rainfed region) and Farm yield (FY). It is the final result of multiple factors, such as environmental factors, management practices, pests, and diseases.
RA3 Number of farmers benefitting from access to input support

This indicator is looking at the number of farmers who are able to benefit from input support schemes that includes resources that are needed to enable production activities in farming for example. seeds, fertilizers.
Income increase from surplus production of targeted crops for direct beneficiaries

This indicator is looking at income increase as a result of Surplus production which refers to the extra crop produces that are Surplus to the household food demand, this excessive amount crop produced by the farmers are sold in the market and the profit is gained. This profit is called surplus. The farmers use the surplus as capital for the next harvest.
